Package goal.core.program

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ActionSpecification
    Container for an ActionSpecification.
    GOALProgram
    Container for a parsed GOAL agent program.
    Message
    A message consists of a sender, a receiver, a SentenceMood of the message, and the content.
    Module
    DOC
    NameSpace
    A name space has two main purposes: It is used as a container to store various program components, such as knowledge, beliefs, goals, action specifications, child modules, and macros.
    SelectExpression
    A SelectExpression represents a single agent or a variable agent or a dynamic set of agents (i.e.
    Selector
    A Selector is used for indicating the mental model(s) that a mental literal should be evaluated on or an action should be applied to.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Module.ExitCondition
    The various exit conditions of a Module: NOGOALS, NOACTION, ALWAYS, and NEVER.
    Module.FocusMethod
    Different methods for creating an attention set associated with a module that is called at runtime.
    Module.TYPE
    Types for distinguishing built-in modules from user-defined modules.
    SelectExpression.SelectorType
    Selector types represent different categories of selector expressions that can be used as prefixes of mental atoms and actions.
    SentenceMood
    The content (sentence) of a message that an agent may send can have one of three different moods: SentenceMood.INDICATIVE SentenceMood.IMPERATIVE SentenceMood.INTERROGATIVE
